text: Dukla Prague () was a Czech football club that was based in Prague, Czechoslovakia (Now Czech Republic). It was created in 1948 as ATK Praha. The club sent seven players to the Czechoslovakia national team that ended as runners-up at the 1962 World Cup. == Managers == The following individuals managed Dukla Prague.Pivoda 2013, p. 36. *Ladislav Ženíšek, Jiří Zástěra (1948) *Ladislav Ženíšek (1949–50) *Karel Kolský (1951–52) *Bohumil Musil (1953) *Karel Kolský (1954–59) *Bohumil Musil (1959–60) *Jaroslav Vejvoda (1960–65) *Bohumil Musil (1965–69) *Milan Tosnar (1965–70) *Jaroslav Vejvoda (1969–73) *Josef Masopust (1973–75) *Jaroslav Vejvoda (1975–80) *Ladislav Novák (1980–85) *Jiří Lopata (1985–87) *Jaroslav Jareš (1987–90) *Ivo Viktor (1990–91) *Michal Jelínek (1991–92) *František Plass (1992) *Jiří Fryš (1993) *Dan Matuška (1993–94) *Svatopluk Bouška (1994) == Honours == Czechoslovak First League *Champions (11): 1953, 1956, 1957–58, 1960–61, 1961–62, 1962–63, 1963–64, 1965–66, 1976–77, 1978–79, 1981–82 Czechoslovak Cup *Winners (8): 1960–61, 1964–65, 1965–66, 1968–69, 1980–81, 1982–83, 1984–85, 1989–90 International Soccer League *Winners: 1960 == References == == Bibliography == *Horák, Jindřich, Král, Lubomír. Encyklopedie našeho fotbalu : Sto let českého a slovenského fotbalu. Domácí soutěže. Praha : Libri, 1997. 704 p. *Jeřábek, Luboš. Český a československý fotbal – lexikon osobností a klubů, Praha: Grada Publishing, 2007. *Pavel, Ota. Dukla mezi mrakodrapy. Praha : Slávka Kopecká, 2004. 183 p. Sebrané spisy Oty Pavla; vol. 1. *Pivoda, Aleš. Legenda se vrátila Praha: MAC, 2013. 157 p. *Sigmund, Stanislav. FC Dukla 1948–1998. Praha : MJF, 1998. 51 p. title: Dukla Prague
